title: Design
text: register-year pairing (including duplicate years) sent separate process. way, rather converting 1000+ registers one , can split chunks based number available CPU cores. instance, set number ‚Äúworkers‚Äù (cores) 4, 1000+ registers split 4 groups group processed simultaneously core. overheads parallel processing, works best large number files files also relatively large, processing time per file substantial.

title: Loading the data: Importing the Parquet format using DuckDB
text: mention SQL briefly vignette("saving--parquet"), ‚Äôll expand . SQL stands ‚ÄúStructured Query Language‚Äù widely used well established way working interacting databases. couple potentially terms clarify mean. Database: Also called ‚Äúrelational database‚Äù. specifically refers file contains one ‚Äútables‚Äù data. table rectangular data object, like see spreadsheet (rows columns). database can contain multiple tables data connected. case, database registers PNR (unique personal ID) connects tables together. Query: query something means request something something else. case querying database, means want get data database. instance, hypothetically want PNR, income, diabetes status born 2000, query database tables columns PNR, income, diabetes status persons whose birth date 2000. Structured: case, means well defined way querying database efficient. ‚Äústructured‚Äù part SQL, something user think , SQL (mostly) automatically makes query efficient . Language: means SQL programming language write code actions. Thankfully, R users don‚Äôt need actually know write SQL dplyr converts many commands automatically SQL commands dataset working SQL database. later. Ok, DuckDB? Well, SQL generic term programming language interacts databases. dozens SQL variants , common ones MySQL, SQLite, Postgres. However, main disadvantage variants aren‚Äôt designed data analysis mind. Many designed needs businesses industry people , researchers data scientists. DuckDB variant designed specifically data analysis mind. Plus, DuckDB can easily interact Parquet data files.

title: Loading the data: Importing the Parquet format using DuckDB
text: Alright, now know SQL DuckDB , use ? load data haven::read_sas() (csv file) data.table readr? particular case, registers MASSIVE databases loading data R thus memory can take quite long time. big advantage SQL/DuckDB doesn‚Äôt load anything memory computation done data done efficient, fast, low-memory way. can lot initial data cleaning, wrangling, summarizing, preparing DuckDB finally loading memory final statistical analysis R‚Äôs functions. basically, reasons : doesn‚Äôt need loaded R, can right away start data wrangling specific project. super fast wrangling, joining, basic summarizing, can quickly get intensive data analysis sooner. doesn‚Äôt use much computer resources like memory, cost environmental sustainability perspective better. importantly, stupid easy work DuckDB within R dplyr (technically dbplyr) ‚Äôll show !

Everyone project folder theoretically package installed, let know don‚Äôt. see list registers available Parquet database, use function: Let‚Äôs take simple register example. ‚Äúftforael‚Äù . Use custom load_database() function registers2parquet package. , need assign ‚Äôll see printed output object says # Source: table<arrow_002> [?? x 12], something similar. means showing small output arrow table (Parquet data format), 12 columns unknown number rows. unknown? DuckDB doesn‚Äôt store anything memory way processes query database, can‚Äôt actually tell many rows database unless specifically ask . us, don‚Äôt really need know point. want wrangling. can use almost dplyr functions end pipe compute(), sends query database get processed. don‚Äôt end compute(), good practice use indicate pipeline want query actually get sent.

title: Saving the SAS databases in Parquet format
text: Parquet data storage format, like CSV, except instead saving data line row dataset (CSV ) saves line file column. means data variable single line. Parquet also saves data multiple files instead one. file structured based grouping factor. case, ‚Äôre keeping ‚Äúregister year‚Äù file structure DST SAS files. means loading data faster instance want registers specific periods time.

what: Why did I choose to use Parquet?
title: Saving the SAS databases in Parquet format
text: Doesn‚Äôt take much disk space (unlike SAS formats). isn‚Äôt super important reason person using working dataset, sustainability reduced impact server point view, ‚Äôs better lower impact higher impact resources. way stored, reading R doesn‚Äôt use much memory. reason DST server nearly 1TB RAM memory ‚Äôs users use? Similar reason , less memory used, less impact resources (sustainability also speed perspective). takes less memory, work data faster. can used multiple ‚Äústructured query languages‚Äù (SQL) common data wrangling tasks fast doesn‚Äôt import data memory. typical way working data R load data memory data analysis tasks. HUGE bottle neck , case server environment like DST, importing data memory can take pretty long time. often, quickly becomes issue. can instead early data wrangling tasks SQL get data smaller size exactly data want, memory use smaller get work done faster.
